content: Is there a specific place for people to talk about the Rust docs? I have some questions (in particular, is there a "style guide")?, as I seem some inconsistencies and aren't sure how, or if, they should be fixed.
For code formatting, just run rustfmt. For api naming there is https://rust-lang.github.io/api-guidelines/naming.html.

Sorry, let me be more precise!

I was editing some docs in the Rust standard library to do with Logic Errors. I found some basically identical text, where in one place cell is referred to as [Cell], and in the other place just Cell is used. I can't really tell why Cell is used some places and [Cell] is used in other places. I wondered if there is a standard, or this is just drift based on who originally wrote the docs.
(there should be backticks around the Cells, they got auto-formatted by Zulip)

[`Cell`] is turned into a link to the documentation of Cell by rustdoc.

Christopher Jefferson said:

(there should be backticks around the Cells, they got auto-formatted by Zulip)

FYI you can double the outer backticks like so: ``[`Cell`]``
@Christopher Jefferson there's not a standard but what I've seen people do is link the item the first time it's used and use inline code blocks everywhere else
Unfortunately the docs team no longer really exists so I don't think there's any centralized guide
With the documentation team apparently disbanded where/how do we discuss any gaps in "The Book"?
